item.title: Once Human’s Next Big Update is Coming Next Week
item.content:encoded:
Once Human’s next big update lands next week, it was announced at Gamescom, as the title continues to grow with more features and experiences.

First released in July 2024, Once Human has grown in the year since, including the launch of a PvP spin-off, RaidZone. Now, the base game itself is getting a big update.

Stellar Resonance is a new gameplay mode that lands in Once Human next week, introducing Gravity Integrators and a host of rewards.

Once Human Stellar Resonance Releases August 28

In a press release sent to Insider Gaming, the Stellar Resonance update is said to “drastically change” gameplay and offer “all-new challenges” for players.

Further details were shared on the official website, with the event period beginning August 28 and running to September 25. After the update is live, players will receive a Gravity Integrator blueprint when a Star Advent Loot Crate is opened for the first time, which can be used at an Intermediate or Advanced Supplies Workbench.

Once placed and activated, the Gravity Integrator will begin to ascend, constantly accumulating Stellar Core Gravity Samples and unlocking tiered rewards the higher it ascends. However, it will also attract Deviants and must be defended.

Global Research is also available in the update, with progress shared across all servers for the same region, unlocking new bonuses and additional reward claim chances. However, the mission is “extremely urgent”, and, if a new research phase is not within five days, bonuses will be lost and attacking Deviants will be stronger.

Additional optimizations were also deployed, including increased gliding and descending speed, improved airbone mechanics, and the ability to cancel aiming when performing a plunging melee attack.

Are far have you gotten in Once Human? Are you excited for the update? Let us know in the Insider Gaming forum.

item.title: Stalker 2 PS5 Release Date Revealed at Gamescom 2025
item.content:encoded:
Stalker 2: Heart of Chornobyl finally has a PS5 release date, and it arrives on November 20, 2025.

GSC Game World’s post-apocalyptic, open-world FPS survival title was released for PC and Xbox Series consoles on November 20, 2024. The title was a timed exclusive for Xbox and is finally set to arrive on a brand new platform this year. The announcement at Gamescom was accompanied by a new trailer, which highlighted details about the PS5 and PS5 Pro versions.

Stalker 2 PS5 Release Date Trailer

Stalker 2’s PS5 release date trailer was revealed during Gamescom’s Opening Night Live. The trailer featured new details about the PS5 version along with a glimpse of the enhanced capabilities of the PS5 Pro version, including increased fidelity and performance.

The PS5 enhancements include:

  • Adaptive Triggers and Haptic Feedback Support
  • Gyro Aiming through Motion Sensor
  • Speakers, Lightbar, and Touchpad Gesture Utilization
  • Tempest 3D Audio
  • Trophies

For the PS5 Pro, players will get:

  • Improved shadow quality and resolution
  • Enhanced global illumination
  • Higher-quality reflections
  • Improved volumetric fog
  • Enhanced volumetric cloud rendering

Stalker 2 2025 Roadmap

As you wait for the PS5 version of Stalker 2, you can check out the 2025 roadmap for the title here. The developers are releasing an engine update soon, with the game being ported to Unreal Engine 5.5.4 to improve optimization further. Moreover, players will have the opportunity to explore new anomalies, missions, weather scenarios, and more.

About Stalker 2

For those unaware of the title, Stalker 2 combines FPS, horror, and immersive sim elements, offering a non-linear story in a seamless open world that leads to one of several possible endings. The game features several survival mechanics, including hunger, sleep, bleeding, radiation effects, as well as dynamic day-night cycles, weather changes, and more. The title is also set to receive a multiplayer mode in the future.

Will you be purchasing Stalker 2: Heart of Chornobyl on the PS5 when it releases on November 20? Let us know through the official Insider Gaming forums discussion.

item.title: Will LEGO Batman: Legacy of The Dark Knight Have Multiplayer? Co-Op & Multiplayer Explained
item.content:encoded:
TT Games is back with a bang with the upcoming release of LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight, telling the story of decades of the Caped Crusader’s history, and multiplayer details have already been announced.

Revealed at Gamescom with a 2026 release window, eyebrows have been raised following news that LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight seemingly only has seven playable characters, which would be a huge change given previous titles have featured hundreds of minifigures to choose from.

Multiplayer has been a core feature in TT Games’ LEGO franchise for years, with no major changes to the format so far. Here, we’ve got all the details on whether that approach is being adjusted with the new LEGO Batman title.

Will LEGO Batman: Legacy of The Dark Knight Have Online Multiplayer?

No, LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight will not support online multiplayer or co-op, it has been confirmed.

In an FAQ post about the game, it was announced that online co-op will not be available, continuing the trend from other LEGO titles from TT Games.

The most recent release, LEGO Star Wars: The Skywalker Saga, also did not feature online co-op. While there has been a desire from players for the feature to be added, it will not be available in LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight.

It remains be seen whether any future LEGO games from TT Games change this trend, though it doesn’t seem likely currently.

Will LEGO Batman: Legacy of The Dark Knight Have Split-Screen Co-Op?

While LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight does not have online co-op support, two-player couch co-op has been confirmed as a feature.

Couch co-op is a staple of TT Games’ LEGO titles, and, while couch co-op is becoming increasingly rarer in modern gaming, LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight will not be removing the feature.

Only two players are supported at a single time, however, which makes sense given that a fair amount of screen space is required to truly enjoy the LEGO experience.

If you’re looking for the next couch co-op title to play with a friend, partner, or other relative, LEGO Batman: Legacy of the Dark Knight could tick the boxes.

item.title: Can You Download The Hollow Knight: Silksong Demo?
item.content:encoded:
Excitement levels continue to rise for Hollow Knight: Silksong ahead of release, and a flood of new gameplay from a demo has made its way online, leading to the question of whether it can be downloaded.

In our hands-on preview, we made it clear that the hype for Hollow Knight: Silksong is well placed, and the assessment from others who have gotten a chance to play at Gamescom is similar. Now, though, players around the world want their own chance to play.

The guide below details everything we know about the Hollow Knight: Silksong demo, including whether you can add it to your library to try out.

Is The Hollow Knight: Silksong Demo Available to Download?

No, there is not currently a Hollow Knight: Silksong demo available to download, and all gameplay footage currently emerging is from Gamescom.

Hollow Knight: Silksong is playable on both Xbox and Nintendo Switch platforms at Gamescom in Cologne, but it is exclusively available at the event for the time being. Therefore, it cannot be downloaded.

The demo is also the same stage of the game that was first playable at E3 2019 six years ago, which, though it may be surprising, could mean it takes place very early in the game.

Fans around the world will need to wait at least a little while longer to get a taste of the game, as currently the only details we know about the playable demo is it’s availability at Gamescom.

Will There Be A Hollow Knight: Silksong Demo?

No announcements have been made regarding a Hollow Knight: Silksong demo, but there could be one provided before launch.

A big Hollow Knight: Silksong announcement is coming today via YouTube, which could reveal the release date or details about a demo, early access, or other details.

If there is a demo, expect it to be available across all platforms, though given the hype for the game, it could release without one.

For now, though, there isn’t a way to play Hollow Knight: Silksong early, but keep an eye on Insider Gaming for more coverage and news as it breaks.
